messages.subject: people looking just alike
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 8/29/02 5:53:51 PM, sjogy@aol.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 8/29/02 5:53:51 PM, sjogy@... writes:

<< I don't know what you could mean! Boromir is just an average ok guy, and
Viggo Mortensen (Aragorn) is gorgeous! Head and shoulders above
what's-his-name <g>. >>

No doubt someday I'll see that!

I have a hard time learning faces. I've always been that way. I would be
the last to know twins apart (we lived in a twin-thick town), and mix up
siblings.

When I first met Keith-to-be-my-husband, he had a best friend, and everyone
called them Keith and Henry, and they were together. Or in the SCA, Heinrich
and Gunwaldt. I didn't need to learn them apart the first six months I knew
them. They both went to singing practice, they both did this, they both did
all the same things. When I DID know them apart, I saw also that one had
reddish hair and one was blonde, and one was taller, and one was heavier.

So maybe it wasn't even the physical appearance, but their social role that I
was "identifying" (or not).

Sandra

Sandra
